sgcool_label_text:This is a special edition prorgramme booklet of the southern tour performances by Hong Kong’s Tai Lung Fung theatre society at the National Theatre. Dubbed the “People’s Theatre” as members of the public had contributed towards the building fund
 the National Theatre was opened in 1963. Apart from being a symbol of national identity and a place where local art performances took place
 it was also the venue for important national events such as National Day rallies
 as well as various cultural shows and performances from the overseas theatre community.  This is a special edition prorgramme booklet of the southern tour performances by Hong Kong’s Tai Lung Fung theatre society at the National Theatre. Dubbed the “People’s Theatre” as members of the public had contributed towards the building fund
 the National Theatre was opened in 1963. Apart from being a symbol of national identity and a place where local art performances took place
 it was also the venue for important national events such as National Day rallies
 as well as various cultural shows and performances from the overseas theatre community.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a special edition prorgramme booklet of the southern tour performances by Hong Kong’s Tai Lung Fung theatre society at the National Theatre. Dubbed the “People’s Theatre” as members of the public had contributed towards the building fund, the National Theatre was opened in 1963. Apart from being a symbol of national identity and a place where local art performances took place, it was also the venue for important national events such as National Day rallies, as well as various cultural shows and performances from the overseas theatre community.  This is a special edition prorgramme booklet of the southern tour performances by Hong Kong’s Tai Lung Fung theatre society at the National Theatre. Dubbed the “People’s Theatre” as members of the public had contributed towards the building fund, the National Theatre was opened in 1963. Apart from being a symbol of national identity and a place where local art performances took place, it was also the venue for important national events such as National Day rallies, as well as various cultural shows and performances from the overseas theatre community.
